ruleset.name: Symfony2 Rules
ruleset.description: Contains rules for the Symfony2 framework.

rule.name: ControllerMethodName
rule.message: The method name should end with Action in this controller.
rule.description: When the class is a concrete implementation and ends with Controller, the method names have to end with Action. If not, it is an indication for business logic in your controller. So you have to outsource your business logic to services or event listeners.

rule.name: EntitySimpleGetterSetter
rule.message: The method should only be a simple {0} in this entity.
rule.description: If the class is an entity, it should contain only simple getter or setter. Otherwise you have a data object and a business object in once. Swap out the methods with business logic to a model. Use a factory or an abstract MappedSuperclass for the model methods.

property.name: entityRegex
property.description: entity regex for class doc comment
